intro: Sisymbrium onuridifolium, commonly known as the Onuris leafed mustard, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like cabbage and mustard. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30 to 60 centimeters and has small, yellow flowers arranged in racemes. Its leaves are pinnately divided, giving it a distinctive appearance. The seeds are small and contain compounds that have been studied for their potential medicinal properties.
